attributes.action: Double All Benefits
attributes.background: All benefits should be doubled. This could be paid for by higher taxes on those more fortunate members of society (e.g Mansion Tax, Higher Corporation Tax etc).

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about behaviour of MPs during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: MPs may raise Points of Order during House of Commons’ debates if they think that an MP has said something offensive or inappropriate. There is no way for members of the public to do this. Members of the public should be able to raise matters of concern with the Speaker, for reporting to the House.
attributes.additional_details: For instance, it was customary for the Speaker to report to the House the conviction of a member by a criminal court even if the sentence did not disqualify them from remaining a member of the House (an example being Mr. Saklatvala in 1926).

attributes.action: Stop the sale and production of genetically modified foods in the uk
attributes.background: These foods are incredibly damaging to our health and environment. The dangers of genetically modified foods has been proven and other countries in Europe have already banned them. I believe that the people of the uk deserve safe nutritious food

attributes.action: Make impersonation of a Paramedic a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Paramedics work hard to get their registration and lean the skills to save a life,however there is an increasing number of people impersonating paramedics. This puts patient saftey at risk and the police. At present it is not illegal to do this unlike impersonating a police officer.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and resale of drop down/side cots
attributes.background: Ashlea-mae lloyd my daughter aged 15mth died due to compression to the neck after her head became trapped in the drop side of these cots 3rd september 2010, darkest day of my life and still haunted to this day. I cannot allow another tragedy like this
attributes.additional_details: Over 70 child deaths recorded since 1970 not including minor/serious injuries to a child 1 death is more than enough. These cots have been banned in America even the resale at carboots/flea markets after millions of of drop down cots were recalled and resulted in yet another infant death in 1996 of which the childs mother bravely campaigned and got them banned, other countries have taken Americas lead in banning these death traps also please please help and support us

attributes.action: A referendum keeping the NHS free for the nation at the service delivery point.
attributes.background: Much publicity has been given to the NHS state, capacity and funding.   To ensure that the NHS is not gifted, sold or used as a political mechanism to further privatisation of the lands, equipment, resources and services presently in provision to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS funding has been restricted to the extent that there is a negative effect on the standards being achieved in patient care, service delivery, restrictions on critical care, the funding of treatments together with staff being in crisis and under valued.  It is time to give the governing elected majority in party parliament a mandate to retain the NHS for the nation or dispose of the NHS by privatisation.

attributes.action: One electronic recording system to safeguard all children and young people
attributes.background: Safeguarding is the responsibility of all agencies, yet we don't all have access to the same system for recording.  We all hold pieces to the puzzle but don't have access to the 'big picture'.  We can only safeguard our young people, if professionals work together to put the pieces together.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation 'Keeping Children Safer in Education' specifies the legal duty for anyone working in Education.  We should have one clear piece of legislation that involves all agencies and states 'What we should do, how we should all work together to achieve it and how we record it.' Too many young people are slipping the net, through agencies not sharing and recording information on the same system.   Lessons learnt from serious case reviews, repeatedly comment on lack of shared communication.

attributes.action: Stop sex offenders living within 1 mile of a school or children's facility
attributes.background: We have recently found out there is a sex offender living next door to our children's school and play area and there are no official plans to move him. If this law was passed it would prevent any sex offender living next to your child's school or play area.

attributes.action: If you turn 18 before the end of the academic year you should be able to vote.
attributes.background: Individuals who turn 18 before the end of the academic should be able to vote. As a young person interested in politics born in August, I am extremely disappointed I am unable to vote in the upcoming elections. I am the same maturity as my fellow peers, and I am affected by the outcome equally.
attributes.additional_details: One example I find uncomfortable, is a close peer of mine turns 18 the day after the EU referendum and yet is unable to vote in a decision which is potentially life altering.

attributes.action: HMRC to make tackling tax evaders its top priority.
attributes.background: The concern is that current direction at the HMRC is compromised; with its focus away from the 'privileged' inner-circle, and instead spread ineffectively elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The well known Pareto Principle or 80-20 rule is widely applied in business. It says that the best results are achieved by spending 80 percent of effort on the top 20 percent of prospects by value. Using the same principle; HMRC should target large-sum avoidance by spending 80% of its resources on the top 20% of companies and individuals by the potential revenue that could be recovered.

attributes.action: Full disclosure of the tax affairs of all members of parliament.
attributes.background: We require transparency on the personal tax activities of members of parliament where they conflict with government policy. Following the Panama Papers leak we demand to know if MPs are involved in tax evasion. We therefore request a full disclosure of all members of parliaments' tax affairs.

attributes.action: Dementia carers give them the recognition and specialist  title they deserve.
attributes.background: It is a requirement for all staff working within dementia to have specialised training and qualifications so I feel they should be recognised for their hard work, passion and dedication in providing high standard of care for people suffering with dementia by making it a specialised career choice
attributes.additional_details: Being a manager of a dementia care home I hear a lot of staff and others refer to the carers as ONLY A CARER I feel this is degrading and demoralising. Their are a lot of good passionate caring carers out there that are not being recognised for this only recognition is bad recognition.Dementia is becoming more progressive and affecting the younger people as well as the elderly. More and more people may be affected by this condition due to people living longer, better awareness and research

attributes.action: Immediately Ban The Artificial Fluoridation Of UK Water Supplies
attributes.background:
Fluoride has recently been classified as a developmental neurotoxicant by the prestigious scientific journal The Lancet, proven to lower a child's IQ: http://goo.gl/5RFiDA

Fluoride is associated with impaired thyroid function resulting in depression, fatigue and weight gain: http://goo.gl/NfzxkI
attributes.additional_details:
Fluoride is linked to dental fluorosis that damages teeth: https://goo.gl/Lw2ebN

Fluoride is damaging to both human and environmental health: https://goo.gl/HXV8Vi

Only four European Union countries back water fluoridation and Germany, the Netherlands and Sweden have discontinued it: http://goo.gl/cVdqwH

Ireland has proposed a 5 year prison sentence for people adding fluoride to the water: http://goo.gl/j8vIkK

It's time for the UK to join these countries for health of the population.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for people with long term mental illness
attributes.background: There is no form of income support for prescriptions for people suffering with long term mental illness mental illness in the long term can have the same debilitating effects as physical impairments and can make you unfit for work so people who suffer with mental illness should get help to pay
attributes.additional_details: To get free prescriptions you need to be; 60 or over, under 16, be 16-18 and in fulltime education, have a MatEx certificate, have a MedEx certificate or you receive either: Income Support, Income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance, Income-related Employment and Support Allowance, or Pension Credit Guarantee Credit

attributes.action: Public apology of UK Government to EU immigrants
attributes.background:
We EU immigrants are hardworking people who want to contribute to the community and we refuse to be portrayed in demeaning light as scroungers. 
We come to work here and pay our taxes. We contribute a huge amount to the UK. We do pay in more than we take out.
attributes.additional_details:
We are being defined as a 'problem', or 'crisis', with bigotry being stoked up against, and as EU citizens living here being denied a voice.
Xenophobia and racism been raised by the referendum campaign which is pulling out hidden hatreds all over the country towards  EU immigrants and have a negative effect on our lives. It fuelled race-based discrimination.
We demand public apology of UK Government and recognize us as British citizens to stop a torrent of racism unleashed by EU referendum.

attributes.action: Parliament to make 24th June a  public bank holiday if the UK vote to leave EU
attributes.background:
If the people of the UK choose to leave the European Union on the 23rd June we request that the British Parliament mark the event / people's decision with a Public Bank Holiday to be known as Britain Independence day from Europe.
(This is about the Country being free of Europe, not race/ religion )

attributes.action: I would like to see the introduction of safe standing at football matches.
attributes.background: I, and many other football fans across the country, believe that the reintroduction of safe standing will produce an enhanced atmosphere at football games. It's been done successfully abroad, notably Germany, for many years. It's time we brought it back!

attributes.action: Re-open Hemel Hempstead Hospital
attributes.background: Sign to try help re open Hemel Hempstead hospital.

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to work shifts with Doctor's and Nurses to comprehend NHS stress.
attributes.background: Jeremy Hunt is killing the NHS. He is obviously oblivious to the basics of emergency, frontline care and the stress, hard work and dedication put into caring for the general public in a life or death situation, throughout the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: He needs to see evidence of his wrong doing, feel the stress himself, watch what his plans are doing and then will not alter doctors contracts, will employ more nurses and stop cuts.

attributes.action: Ban fire works restrict sales to 48 hours prior to bonfire night
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of fire works until 48 hours prior to an event, create a new law to controll fireworks the current noise and curfews do nothong 
Animal cruelty should should be a number one concern
attributes.additional_details: Just Google the effect on animals it's all there

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time. This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods.

The proposed Benefit would be funded by introducing a levy of 50% of UK Profits on companies who move their operations - in whole or in part - outside the UK.

attributes.action: Make youth services a statutory provision for local authorities.
attributes.background: At present, local authorities do not need to provide youth services, legally. As a result of this, the majority of LA's have axed their youth services.This petition would seek to protect youth services in law, so that young people have a strong support network and develop skills people need for life
attributes.additional_details: A government report into the 2011 London Riots linked the closure of youth provision in North London to the violence seen in London. It costs  £200,000 of taxpayers money for every young person who passes through the criminal justice system by the age of 16 (Audit Commission). For every young person who accesses youth services, it costs £350 per young person.That's a huge amount of money saved. By protecting young services we not only save money,we help to build confident and skilled individuals

attributes.action: Fix the age for entitlement to the state pension to 60 for both men and women
attributes.background:
With high UK unemployment this would free jobs held by people at 60 years of age and older who wish to retire and release them for the unemployed and youth of the country.
This would be funded by the reduction to the welfare budget by those who come off benefits and instead would be paying taxes.

attributes.action: Properly clarify status of encryption in The Investigatory Powers Bill
attributes.background: The draft bill suggests that communications providers may have to remove "protection". The joint committee says the bill should make clear that this be only where technically practicable. This does not quite go far enough. We need a clear statement allowing CPs to offer secure communications.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill MUST make clear that CPs can offer secure communications which cannot be read or intercepted even with a warrant or with an intercept order or order to maintain an intercept capability.

Without this people (in UK and overseas) cannot trust CPs offering secure communications, and trust is essential in this industry.

Even as worded now, the bill allows criminals to communicate using own encryption, so that battle is lost. We need to allow non-criminals the same benefit using CP services

attributes.action: Repeal the decision that forces hospitals to stop providing heart surgery.
attributes.background: Three hospitals in Leicester, Manchester and London have just been ordered to stop surgery on patients born with heart disorders by April 2017. This puts the lives of many patients at risk. Force our government to invest in heart units and not to abandon those, like me, with heart conditions.
attributes.additional_details: If a standard of care is deemed unsatisfactory every effort should be made to raise that standard considerably to save lives. Our government shouldn't be abandoning people with heart disorders and rejecting the phenomenal work of those doctors who strive to provide the best care for their patients. This decision will also force patients and their families to travel great and costly distances. The government is putting lives at an even greater risk by shutting down these services.

attributes.action: Have mental health nurses working with schools in the same way school nurses do.
attributes.background: As part of the targeted mental health in schools scheme the government has tried to improve mental health education to children of school age but it is not about teaching mental health its about providing support for both staff and students.
attributes.additional_details:
Having mental health nurses in schools enables comprehensive mental health service delivery at the heart of education taking responsible away from teaching staff who's sole responsibility is to teach and brings in professionals trained to deal with these specific issues.

Figures have shown increases year after year of children school aged suffering from mentally ill health but it doesn't have to be bringing in mental health nurses at an early intervention stage will promote mental health and emotional wellbeing when transition to college, university or the world of work. 

It's about time we stand up for the children of today, the adults of tomorrow and support them through their hardships by giving them the tools that only mental health nurses can provide in their time of need

attributes.action: We want to stop event organisers charging 'booking fees' added to every ticket
attributes.background: It has become normal for event organisers to charge a 'booking fee' to every transaction and usually added to the face value of every ticket. This is not a booking fee and does not reflect any cost incurred by the event organiser in selling tickets.
attributes.additional_details: Booking fees may have stemmed from third-party sales of event tickets but are now charged by event organisers themselves, as a way of hiking the face value of tickets. The event organiser does not incur any additional cost in selling tickets - this is the normal course of their business, and the equivalent of a supermarket charging a 'shopping fee.'

attributes.action: Pressure the UN to protect hospitals from illegal attacks in war zones
attributes.background: Hospitals have been the target of many recent attacks in Syria. All those involved in the death of civilians, health care workers and destruction of hospitals need to be indicted for war crimes. Healthcare workers must be protected. The UK government should put pressure on the UN to do this.
attributes.additional_details:
"Healthcare is seen as a weapon – you take out a doctor, you take out 10,000 people they can’t care for" 

Over 60 MSF hospitals in Syria have been bombed. 

We need to ensure that humanitarian aid reaches the victims of conflict and does not itself succumb to violence. 

Destruction of hospitals is leaving civilians in war zones without much needed healthcare. The UN security council, the UK government and all the powers involved in the region must do more, for the simple sake of saving lives.

attributes.action: Delete "journalism, art or literature" exemptions from the FOI Act
attributes.background: Schedule 1, Part VI of the Freedom Of Information Act 2000 lists a number of organisations granted special exemption, where the Act only applies to information "held for purposes other than those of journalism, art or literature". This is misused to reject ANY FOI requests they'd rather not answer.
attributes.additional_details:
They use a very loose interpretation of this exemption to support these rejections, as everything they do can be linked back to one of these three categories.

They make frequent use of the Act to interrogate other public sector organisations in their journalistic research, yet use the JAoL clause to shield themselves from similar investigation.

We therefore request that these exemptions be deleted from the FOI Act, leaving them open to the same level of scrutiny as other public bodies.

attributes.action: STOP the roll out of PIP in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency opens
attributes.background: Currently the Conservatives are rolling out PIP around Scotland affecting millions of people but I think this should be stopped in Scotland until the new Scottish benefit agency in announced and operating

attributes.action: Better care and treatment of people with Neurological Disorders, under UK Law
attributes.background: There are many of British Citizens today, living with various Neurological Disorders, but unlike people with Mental Health issues, there are no strategies, for their conditions, the above when being dealt by the Police or CPS, they also want to treated equally under UK Law.

attributes.action: Compensate schools for increased costs - reverse the 8% spending cut per pupil.
attributes.background: State schools in England face a budget crisis because of increased National Insurance and pension contributions. They will need to find savings of around £1bn per year to balance their budgets in coming years. Class sizes are increasing and teachers are already being made  redundant as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
From the Institute of Fiscal Studies, publication 8027

“increasing costs and increasing pupil numbers mean that resources per pupil are likely to fall significantly.”

“school spending per pupil is likely to fall by around 8% in real terms (based on a school specific measure of inflation) between 2014–15 and 2019–20.”

“this will be the first time since the mid-1990s that school spending has fallen in real terms (when spending per pupil fell by 3.6% in real terms between 1993 and 1997).”

attributes.action: Make the Speakership a Commons position in its own right, remove his MP status
attributes.background: The Speaker (and the three Deputy Speakers) are not allowed to speak or vote in debates which means that they can't represent their constituents properly. We believe that the Speakers should be staff roles rather than being an MP which effectively disenfranchses 4 constituencies (approx 280k people)
attributes.additional_details: This has been considered before by the Procedure Committee and several times (more in the past) before then ( http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201012/cmselect/cmproced/1573/157305.htm ). But we don't agree with the idea that the Speaker is 'most representative of the popular will' (quoted, 22.) since he is not allowed to express the opinion of his constituents in debate. His ability to speak to Government Ministers is not adequate compensation - since they stick to their views anyway.

attributes.action: Introduce a law on animal Medication advice and distribution
attributes.background: We want to change advice owners get from their vets in the UK with regards purchasing medication for their animals and introduce a statutory prescription charge. Many owners do not know that they can purchase a written prescription from the vet and get the medication from a pharmacy at reduced price
attributes.additional_details:
The reason we are petitioning for a change is that many owners cannot afford the medication charges from the vets especially for long term conditions and face the hard decision to put their pets to sleep, giving their pets up to animal welfare organisations or worse abandoning their pet. Prescription charges range from £8.00 to £15.00 depending on which vet you use.
With Blu's Law we would reduce the amount of abandoned animals and animals put to sleep needlessly.

attributes.action: Ultra sound scans of ovaries as part of the smear screening process
attributes.background: My name is Sam. I'm a 31 year old mother of 2. I've always stayed up to date with my checks. Having had a baby 8 month ago delivered by c section I had a tender pain in my abdomen still to this day. After being admitted to A&E suspected appendicitis. It turns out I have a 17cm cyst on my ovary
attributes.additional_details:
If it wasn't for the sharp pain I experienced one day. I would never have know about this cyst. I have an appointment now to have a full hysterectomy (my choice as I want no risk of anything returning). As the cyst is classed as suspicious. 
I believe if you arrange for ultra sounds to be done at the same appointment as women having smear tests. We can reduce the risk of other women living with these possibly life threatening undetected growths.

attributes.action: Reform the democratic system to work honestly for the people it serves.
attributes.background:
Many people voted for Brexit to regain power. The ‘remain’ people want the same. It unites us both. We all want to have control over our own lives. Primarily this depends on a government genuinely working for us. This requires a total reformation of our systems of democracy. 
So we demand,
attributes.additional_details:
Proportional representation.
A published declaration of party policies/intentions before general elections, which must be held.
Early general elections called if those promises are broken.
An elected upper house.
A cap on donations of £5000 - instead state funding for a system owned by the people it serves and policies not able to be bought.
A law ensuring the media correct any inaccuracies or misleading statements on the same page, fitting format with the original article, with an apology.

attributes.action: Petition for a vote of no confidence in Parliament against the Prime Minister
attributes.background: no background except to bring the Prime Minister to account for his actions over the EU renegotiation

attributes.action: Revoke and Repeal the Act of Union 1707 (Treaty of Union)
attributes.background: In 1707 two Acts of Parliament was formed. This is called the 'Treaty of Union'. Revoke that Act to renegotiated and push for separate independent states. ie a 'United England'
attributes.additional_details: The Acts of Union were two Acts of Parliament: the Union with Scotland Act 1706 passed by the Parliament of England, and the Union with England Act passed in 1707 by the Parliament of Scotland. They put into effect the terms of the Treaty of Union that had been agreed on 22 July 1706, following negotiation between commissioners representing the parliaments of the two countries. By the two Acts, the Kingdom of England and the Kingdom of Scotland—which at the time were separate states with separate legislatures, but with the same monarch—were, in the words of the Treaty, "United into One Kingdom by the Name of Great Britain"

attributes.action: Make the 5th of July NHS day, and a national holiday.
attributes.background: I feel that many now, so far on from it's inception truly understand a lot about when and how it started. As a whole, we just take it for granted, and have become blase about it. Yet it's treated all of us, saved lives, including my own, and more than once. It deserves to be celebrated by us all.

attributes.action: Reduce the ielts score for English born nurses who completed nursing outside EU
attributes.background:
I was born & school/colleged in the UK, then travelled to NZ in 2004 & completed my nursing degree & worked in Emergency. I am now struggling to come back & work in the UK due to british council requirements of the ielts score of 7 which has nothing to do with Nursing! 
Please sign if you agree
attributes.additional_details:
British citizen school/college in Portsmouth.
Trained in New Zealand as nurse at University.
Now trying to continue nursing in own country but too many barriers in doing so, due to British council policies in making everyone sit the ielts exam at £150 per time which has NOTHING to do with Nursing. 
UK hospitals screaming out for nurses, something needs to change, I'M ENGLISH and passionate about my nursing.
please share/sign and help if you agree

attributes.action: Make Commercial Dog Walking a licensed and inspected practice.
attributes.background: In recent years, Commercial dog walking has become big business. Seemingly, all people need is a van & a love of dogs. Some provide excellent service helping our dogs to have a better life whilst we work, however there are many who walk up to 20 dogs, do not clean up, & cannot control the pack.
attributes.additional_details: Kennels & Boarders are licenced & inspected & must be suitable people, trained and insured to protect OUR pets. I have seen many Commercial Dog Walkers who cannot control the dogs they walk. The dogs foul areas & act as a pack, causing fear/ injury to other dog walkers, dogs, livestock & land users. A license should be a requirement to allow Authorities to inspect vehicles used to transport dogs, check on insurance and the walkers experience. Numbers walked commercially must also be limited.

attributes.action: No blame approach to adoptive parents when disruption occurs
attributes.background: Add a new entry box Children's Act 1989 Part IVsec31: "has complex medical and/or psychological reasons". This is a neutral and no blame approach to the breakdown where parental love and devotion are not the issues when adoption disruption occurs.
attributes.additional_details:
CARE ORDER Form C110A fails to protect natural and adoptive parents whose child is returned to Care for complex medical and/or psychological reasons. As per Children's Act 1989 Part IVsec31, reasons: • not receiving care that would be reasonably expected from a parent, or • is beyond parental control

Add new entry box in Section 4: "has complex medical and/or psychological reasons". This is a neutral and no blame approach to the breakdown where parental love and devotion are not the issues.

attributes.action: Re-open the railway line between Matlock, Bakewell, Buxton and Manchester
attributes.background: We need an efficient and environmentally friendly transport network for the future and increasing reliance on energy hungry private vehicles is poor sense in a world with finite resources. Furthermore reopening this line can only be good for the economy of the local area and bring more tourists.
attributes.additional_details: A feasibility study was carried out in the past and although financially unviable at the time, a decade has now passed and it's a whole different situation. Passenger numbers have grown astronomically, all but one of the stations along the current Derwent Valley Line have seen passenger numbers more than double over this time. Rail travel is also in demand more than ever. Tourism and the local economy would undoubtedly be boosted in the town of Bakewell, as well as other areas the route covers.

attributes.action: Return Sex Education to UK schools and update it for the 21st Century
attributes.background: Due to the recent decision by the education secretary Ms Morgan to remove compulsory sex education from UK schools, we petition & campaign to have it returned to the curriculum & propose it be updated to a wonder view of sexual & relationship education in the 21st Century Age of Information.
attributes.additional_details:
achieving the extraordinary feat of uniting four parliamentary select committees, five teaching unions, the Children’s commissioner, the Chief Medical Officer, the Association of Police and Crime Commissioners, two royal societies and no less than six medical royal colleges. 

Education Secretary Nicky Morgan ruled out making sex education compulsory for all schools. Strange, not just due so many wise and knowledgable people wanted mandatory sex education, but also because Mrs Morgan herself did

attributes.action: Lower car insurance for ages 17-25. No matter on Postcode.
attributes.background: Car insurance for ages 17-25 is ridiculous and it also changes on Postcode.  If you were to be 18 and living on Postcode TW2 it will cost less by around £800 annual for the exact same car than a postcode which is TW13..

attributes.action: Referendum on the renewal of the Trident nuclear submarine programme
attributes.background: We should be able to make the decision on whether or not the UK Government spends billions of pounds on the Trident nuclear missile programme, or if we would like it to be spent elsewhere within our economy as some sources estimate that renewal could be upwards of £200bn.

attributes.action: Bring VAT back down to 15% immediately after EU exit has been completed
attributes.background: Give honest working UK tax payers and families a much needed economical boost and shot in the arm. With new global trade deals now possible and a recouped EU membership bill lets force competition in the market place and give the consumer a chance to really contribute to incrrasing overall GDP

attributes.action: Review the Child Maintenance system, and the people employed to serve there.
attributes.background: We, resident and non resident parents and carers, believe that the current child maintainance system is not fit for purpose and that it should be reviewed. Service users find that the system is treating them unfairly, that the employees can be unprofessional and that there is maladministration.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/child-maintenance
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maladministration

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in George Osborne.
attributes.background: George Osborne has consistently failed to meet his own targets thereby proving beyond any shadow of a doubt the level of his incompetence. A vote of no confidence should be sought in an effort to have him removed from his post before he inflicts any further fiscal carnage on the British economy.
attributes.additional_details:
1. The OBR has a gloomier outlook for the future than he does.
2. He will breach his own 'Charter for Budget Responsibility' as the GDP debt ratio rises in the coming year. . again.
3. He will miss his welfare cap target in the coming year... again.
4. His predicted budget surplus in 2019-2020 is more accurately predicted by the OBR as a 3.5bn deficit. His own accountancy on the matter is more based on 'creative assumption' than actual fact.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 destroying our villages in Barnburgh and Harlington. No to HS2
attributes.background: HS2 wants to run a high speed train through Mexborough, destroying homes, & Barnburgh and Harlington, destroying countryside. If it gets the go-ahead 18 trains per hour - running 5am until midnight - will pass through our town/villages. Sign this petition to say NO to HS2 destroying our area.
